moves.1. e4: My favorite first move. King's pawn defense.
moves.1... e5: He replies, mirroring my first move.
moves.2. Nf3: I threaten his pawn and develop my knight.
moves.3. d4: I attack his e-pawn, being protected by my queen and my knight.
moves.3... exd4: He takes my pawn with his own.
moves.4... Qf6: I thought he would just take the knight, but he decides to put pressure on it instead.
moves.5. Nxc6: I just simply take the knight.
moves.5... dxc6: He takes back, now with doubled up pawns and an open king.
moves.6... Bd7: My opponent looking to castle queenside.
moves.7. h4: Now, if he castles queenside, I will pin his queen to his rook.
moves.7... O-O-O: He falls for the trap, and castles queenside.
moves.8. Bg5: I pin his queen to his rook with my bishop.
moves.9... Kxd8: He takes my bishop and now I am +2 and in a good position.
moves.10. Qf3: Wanting to develop my bishop, I protect the g2 square.
moves.11. Bd3: I develop my bishop, preparing: e5, threatening his knight with my pawn and his queen with my bishop.
moves.12. Qe3: I move out of the way.
moves.12... Nh5: Moves out of the threat, but now his knight is trapped.
moves.14... Qxf5: He takes back with the queen.
moves.15. O-O-O+: I castle queenside, checking the king.
moves.15... Kc8: After this bad move, my opponent abandoned the game, probably because he didn't want to be beaten by a player with 500 less rating than him.
